etymons.meaning: to hollow out, dig; to dig through; to hew out;

Infectum.text: u+Laḥdo konoqar i+šeno ‘Lahdo is carving  the rock’ (the rock is being crushed slowly, piece by piece) (Ilyas p.c.) turkish: oyma

Preterit.text: 3) mədla tre=ḥabuše, nqəlla kul ḥḏo mənne ḥa b-qarʕa ʻdamit nahm sie zwei Äpfel und knallte jeder der beiden einen an den Kopfʼ; 95/155; nqərre ruḥaye b-an=nawqat də-ḥḏoḏe ʻsie platzten mit den Leibern aufeinanderʼ; 95/119;
nqəlle ruḥe ʻer stürzte sich aufʼ; 254; 95/155 (where?);
25. As+sobahkàr koṯən, kəmḥalqi ruḥayye lu+baḥar, koduʕri. Mḥalqi ruḥayye lu+baḥar. Ga, u+zʕuro ínaqqa domar ‘ay’, i+Ndaṯalo nqīr‿ebe. Nqīr‿ebe, mədla ŭ ṭʕəḷḷa.

The swimmers come, they toss themselves into the sea, they return. They toss themselves into the sea. Look,  the boy, when he says ‘oh!’, the Theotokos swooped down onto him, she swooped down onto him, she grabbed him and carried him off. (Mother Mary Saves the Sultan’s Son)
Ono kalyo – u+safruno nqīr ebi ‘I am standing – the bird crashed into me’ (Abdu+Lmasīḥ)
